title: Cesc Fabregas reacts to Granit Xhaka’s outburst towards Arsenal fans
text:
Granit Xhaka hit out at Arsenal fans during the draw with Crystal Palace (BPI/REX)

Cesc Fabregas has expressed the view of many Arsenal fans after watching Granit Xhaka lose it with the Gunners supporters during the 2-2 draw with Crystal Palace on Sunday.

Unai Emery’s side threw away a two-goal lead and were held by Roy Hodgson’s side at the Emirates Stadium.

But Arsenal fans turned on Xhaka as he was substituted in the 61st minute.

The Arsenal captain was booed by the club’s supporters as he walked off the pitch and the midfielder then cupped his ear and mouthed ‘f*** off’.

A furious Xhaka then slapped Emery’s outstretched hand, took off his shirt and stormed straight down the tunnel.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Fabregas, who made over 300 appearances for Arsenal and captained the team for nearly three years, was clearly watching his former side in action as moments after Xhaka’s incident, the midfielder posted a flush-faced emoji on Twitter.

Arsenal fans clearly got the message as they responded by directing further abuse towards Xhaka by way of Fabregas’ post.

Cesc Fabregas sent a clear message after Granit Xhaka’s strop (Twitter)

Emery, meanwhile, now faces a decision over whether Xhaka should remain as captain following his outburst towards Arsenal’s supporters.

‘He’s wrong but we are going to speak inside about that situation,’ Emery said after the match.

‘I want to be calm but, really, he was wrong in this action.’
